The mass of a body measures the amount of matter it contains, while weight measures the force with which the planet attracts that body. Its value is: F=m·g where g is the intensity of gravity, that is, the force that experiences the unit of mass. The mass always has the same value, while the weight depends on the value of g, which is not identical everywhere.
